intro: Galarhoeus cyparissias, commonly known as the cypress spurge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It features erect, branching stems that are often reddish in color and covered with fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on the upper parts of the stems. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a waxy texture with a slightly serrated margin. Galarhoeus cyparissias is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
